title: Direct q with actor

description:
## Files
- internal/comments/profile.go (modify)

## What to do

In `fetchProfile`, line 57, the DID is interpolated directly into the URL without encoding:

```go
url := fmt.Sprintf("%s/xrpc/app.bsky.actor.getProfile?actor=%s", apiURL, did)
```

While ATProto DIDs (`did:plc:...`) don't currently contain characters that break URLs, this is technically incorrect. The heartbeads web app uses `encodeURIComponent(did)` for this same call.

Fix by using `net/url.QueryEscape(did)`:

```go
import "net/url"

url := fmt.Sprintf("%s/xrpc/app.bsky.actor.getProfile?actor=%s", apiURL, url.QueryEscape(did))
```

Or better, use `net/url.URL` to build the URL properly:
```go
u, _ := url.Parse(apiURL + "/xrpc/app.bsky.actor.getProfile")
q := u.Query()
q.Set("actor", did)
u.RawQuery = q.Encode()
```

### Verify
All existing tests in `./internal/comments/` must still pass. The URL encoding should be transparent to the test mock servers (httptest parses query params correctly either way).

- Don't change any function signatures
- Don't change any test files

title: Fix rewriteOutput corrupting injected --reason values
description:
## Files
- executor.go (modify — rewriteOutput or runBd)
- inject.go (modify — getLatestGitCommit)
- executor_test.go (modify — add test case)

## What to do

### Bug

When `hb close` auto-injects `--reason` from the latest git commit, the commit message passes through `rewriteOutput()` which replaces "bd" with "hb". So a commit message like "fix: improve output rewriting to handle single-quoted bd commands" gets stored as "fix: improve output rewriting to handle single-quoted hb commands".

This is wrong — the close reason should preserve the original text.

### Root cause

The issue is architectural: `runBd()` rewrites ALL stdout/stderr output, including the JSON response that echoes back the `--reason` value. But the corruption happens earlier — the `--reason` value itself is correct when passed to bd. It's the JSON *response* that gets rewritten.

Actually, the real problem is subtle: the `--reason` value passes through correctly to bd. The corruption is only in the *echoed output* — bd stores the correct value in the database, but the JSON it prints back has "bd" → "hb" applied. So the stored data is correct, but the CLI output is misleading.

### Fix approach

The simplest fix: don't rewrite `rewriteOutput` on JSON output (lines starting with `{` or `[`). JSON responses should be passed through verbatim.

In `rewriteOutput`, add an early return for JSON:

```go
func rewriteOutput(input []byte) []byte {
    if len(input) == 0 {
        return input
    }

    // Don't rewrite JSON output — it contains user data that should be preserved
    trimmed := bytes.TrimLeft(input, " \t\n\r")
    if len(trimmed) > 0 && (trimmed[0] == '{' || trimmed[0] == '[') {
        return input
    }

    result := string(input)
    for _, p := range rewritePatterns {
        result = p.re.ReplaceAllString(result, p.repl)
    }
    return []byte(result)
}
```

### Test

Add a test case to `executor_test.go` TestRewriteOutput:
```go
{
    name:  "JSON output preserved",
    input: `{"close_reason":"fix bd rewriting"}`,
    want:  `{"close_reason":"fix bd rewriting"}`,
},
{
    name:  "JSON array preserved",
    input: `[{"title":"fix bd bug"}]`,
    want:  `[{"title":"fix bd bug"}]`,
},
```

## Test
go test -v -run "TestRewriteOutput" ./... && go test -v ./...

## Dont
- Change how --reason is injected in inject.go
- Break non-JSON output rewriting (prose text should still be rewritten)
- Add complex JSON detection — just check first non-whitespace char

## What to do

Create a Bluesky profile resolver in `internal/comments/profile.go`.

### Function signature:
```go
// ResolveProfiles resolves Bluesky profiles for a list of DIDs.
// Makes HTTP requests to the Bluesky public API. Falls back to a stub profile
// (DID as handle) on any error. Never returns an error — all failures are graceful.
// The returned map has one entry per unique input DID.
func ResolveProfiles(ctx context.Context, apiURL string, dids []string) map[string]Profile
```

### Behavior:
- For each unique DID, GET `{apiURL}/xrpc/app.bsky.actor.getProfile?actor={did}`
- Parse JSON response fields: `handle`, `displayName`, `avatar`, `did`
- Build a `Profile` struct (type defined in types.go)
- On any error (HTTP error, invalid JSON, timeout): use fallback profile `{DID: did, Handle: did}`
- Deduplicate: if the same DID appears multiple times in input, only resolve once
- Empty input: return empty map (not nil)
- Concurrency: use a semaphore (buffered channel of size 5) to limit concurrent requests
- Use `sync.WaitGroup` + goroutines for parallel resolution
- Pass context to `http.NewRequestWithContext` for cancellation

### Response JSON shape from Bluesky public API:
```json
{
  "did": "did:plc:abc",
  "handle": "alice.bsky.social",
  "displayName": "Alice",
  "avatar": "https://cdn.bsky.app/img/avatar/..."
```

description:
## Files

## What to do

### Part 1: assemble.go — Thread assembly functions

```go
// FilterBeadsComments returns only records whose value.subject.uri starts with "beads:".
func FilterBeadsComments(records []IndexerRecord) []IndexerRecord

// ExtractNodeID extracts the beads issue ID from a record's value.subject.uri field.
// For subject.uri="beads:my-issue-123", returns "my-issue-123".
// Returns empty string if the record has no valid beads subject URI.
func ExtractNodeID(record IndexerRecord) string

// AssembleComments converts raw IndexerRecords into BeadsComment structs.
// Attaches like counts and resolved profile info.
// Parameters:
//   - commentRecords: filtered comment records (already filtered to beads: URIs)
//   - likeRecords: all like records (will be matched by comment URI)
//   - profiles: resolved profiles (DID -> Profile map)
// Returns a flat list of BeadsComment (not yet threaded).
func AssembleComments(commentRecords, likeRecords []IndexerRecord, profiles map[string]Profile) []BeadsComment

// BuildThreads takes a flat list of BeadsComment and builds threaded trees.
// Comments with replyTo pointing to another comment's URI become children (nested in Replies).
// Root comments (no replyTo, or orphaned replyTo) are sorted newest-first by CreatedAt.
// Replies within each thread are sorted oldest-first (chronological).
// Returns only root-level comments (replies are nested inside).
func BuildThreads(comments []BeadsComment) []BeadsComment

// FilterByNodeID returns only comments (root-level) whose NodeID matches the given ID.
func FilterByNodeID(comments []BeadsComment, nodeID string) []BeadsComment
```

### FilterBeadsComments behavior:
- Check record.Value["subject"] is a map with key "uri"
- Check that "uri" value is a string starting with "beads:"
- Use type assertions carefully (Value is map[string]interface{})

### ExtractNodeID behavior:
- Access record.Value["subject"].(map[string]interface{})["uri"].(string)
- Strip "beads:" prefix (use strings.TrimPrefix with the BeadsURIPrefix constant)
- Return "" on any type assertion failure

### AssembleComments behavior:
- Build a map of comment URI -> count of likes (from likeRecords where value.subject.uri matches a comment URI)
- For each commentRecord: extract nodeId, text (value["text"]), createdAt (value["createdAt"]), replyTo (value["replyTo"]), look up profile by record.DID
- If profile not found, use DID as handle
- Create BeadsComment with Likes count, empty Replies slice

### BuildThreads behavior:
- Index all comments by URI in a map
- Iterate: if comment.ReplyTo is non-empty and parent exists in map, append to parent.Replies
- Otherwise, treat as root
- Sort root comments: newest CreatedAt first (descending)
- Sort replies recursively: oldest CreatedAt first (ascending)
- Return root comments only

### Part 2: fetch.go — Fetch orchestrator

```go
// FetchComments fetches all comments for a specific beads issue from the Hypergoat indexer.
// Orchestrates: fetch records (comments + likes in parallel), filter, resolve profiles, assemble, thread, filter by ID.
// Returns threaded comments for the given beadsID, newest-first at root level.
func FetchComments(ctx context.Context, indexerURL, profileAPIURL, beadsID string) ([]BeadsComment, error)
```

### FetchComments behavior:
1. Fetch comment records and like records in parallel using goroutines:
   - `FetchRecordsByCollection(ctx, indexerURL, CommentCollection)`
   - `FetchRecordsByCollection(ctx, indexerURL, LikeCollection)`
2. If comment fetch fails, return error. If like fetch fails, continue with empty likes.
3. Filter comment records: `FilterBeadsComments(commentRecords)`
4. Collect unique DIDs from filtered comment records
5. Resolve profiles: `ResolveProfiles(ctx, profileAPIURL, dids)`
6. Assemble: `AssembleComments(filteredComments, likeRecords, profiles)`
7. Build threads: `BuildThreads(assembled)`
8. Filter: `FilterByNodeID(threaded, beadsID)`
9. Return filtered comments

### Required test functions:

**assemble_test.go:**
- `TestFilterBeadsComments` - 3 records: 2 with beads: URIs, 1 with at:// URI; verify 2 returned
- `TestFilterBeadsCommentsEmpty` - empty input; verify empty non-nil slice
- `TestExtractNodeID` - record with subject.uri="beads:test-id"; verify returns "test-id"
- `TestExtractNodeIDInvalid` - record with no subject or non-beads URI; verify returns ""
- `TestAssembleComments` - 2 comment records + 1 like record; verify 2 BeadsComment with correct like count
- `TestBuildThreads` - 3 comments: 1 root, 1 reply to root, 1 reply to reply; verify tree structure (root has 1 reply, that reply has 1 reply)
- `TestBuildThreadsSortOrder` - 2 root comments with different timestamps; verify newest-first; 2 replies with different timestamps; verify oldest-first
- `TestBuildThreadsOrphanReply` - comment with replyTo pointing to non-existent URI; verify treated as root
- `TestFilterByNodeID` - 3 root comments with 2 different nodeIDs; verify correct filtering

**fetch_test.go:**
- `TestFetchComments` - mock both indexer (returns 2 comment records + 1 like for beads:test-id) and profile API; verify returns 2 threaded comments with correct nodeID and like count
- `TestFetchCommentsNotFound` - mock indexer returns comments for different beads IDs; verify empty result for requested ID
- `TestFetchCommentsLikesFail` - mock indexer: comments succeed, likes return 500; verify comments still returned (with 0 likes)

## Don't
- Don't add any new dependencies
- Don't modify types.go, client.go, or profile.go
- Don't create any files besides assemble.go, fetch.go, assemble_test.go, fetch_test.go
- Don't use time.Parse for sorting — compare CreatedAt strings directly (ISO 8601 strings are lexicographically sortable)

### FormatText output example:
```
@alice.bsky.social (2025-01-15T10:00:00Z) [2 likes]
  This is a root comment
  @bob.bsky.social (2025-01-15T11:00:00Z)
    This is a reply

      Nested reply
@dave.bsky.social (2025-01-15T13:00:00Z)
  Another root comment
```

- Header line: `{indent}@{handle} ({createdAt})` — add ` [{N} likes]` only if likes > 0 (use "like" for 1, "likes" for >1)
- If displayName is non-empty, show `{indent}{displayName} @{handle} ({createdAt})` instead
